casebody.data:
GROGAN v. UNITED STATES. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. December 19, 1921.) No. 33. Tn Error to the District Court of the United States for the Southern District of New York. Robert Grogan was convicted of conspiracy to violate the National Motor Vehicle Theft Act, and he brings error. Affirmed. William J. Fallon, of New York City, for plaintiff in error. William Hayward and Francis G. Caffey, TJ. S. Attys., boih of New York City (John H. Joyce, Asst. U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before ROGERS, MANTON, and MAYER, Circuit Judges.

PER OUR1AM.

Judgment affirmed.
